lines.text: A woman, I always say, is born for widowhood. It is her natural vocation. A woman is incomplete until himself is six feet under.

[after having pulled a patient's tooth]
No-one's going to tell me *I* don't disinfect.
[takes a drink from his flask]
The first day I clapped eyes on that one, I made up my mind. If she ends up as anyone's widow, it'll be as mine. Or I'll swing for her.
That's the Lucy girl.
The poor creature.
What poor? Now we gave her every chance, so we did. "Get it adopted," we said to her. But no. No, she'd sooner make a show of herself *and* of us.
Where will she go?
Where do you think she'll go? Why else did God, in his goodness, invent England?
In Kilshannon, Mrs. Broome, widows are as plentiful as freckles on a redhead.
I came to Kilshannon for the climate.
What climate? We are in Ireland.
Nigel had often spoken so affectionately of Ireland. He loved this country so. He told me how he used to come here for the shooting.
Really? What did he shoot? Irishmen?
Miss O'Hare! Honest to God.
Why not? It isn't as if we're ever out of season.
I don't like lawyers. They consort with criminals.
No, they don't, they consort with other lawyers.
That's what I said.
When I receive your proposal, I'll consider it. Meanwhile... it's customary to provide a sample of goods on offer.
Um... who's going to provide the sample?
Think of it as mutual. Tit for tat.
The poor thing hasn't two ha'pennies to rub together.
Maybe she credits me with being smarter than I am, but at last I know a gold ring from the brass one you'd find in a sweet cake on Halloween.
Well, it's all right rowing ashore, but rowing back to the cruiser isn't.
Do you mean because of the currents on the lake?
No, I mean because of the pubs on the land.
Are we sinking? I can't swim.

[chuckles]
It won't be necessary. One of the few advantages of going aground is that you can walk ashore.
And, forgive me, but are there *non*-teetotal beverages available?
Not for the likes of them that's had enough.

[in an English accent]
Permit me, ma'am. First Lieutenant Rokesby of His Majesty's ship Heroic. At your service, ma'am. The fact is, I've had a somewhat chequered 24 hours. Fell into bad company in Dublin last night and missed my ship. Courtesy visit, you know, not bombardment.
And the devil's cure to you.
You and I, as snug as two bugs.
Even when the English are murdering you, they're always thorough gentlemen.
We have had 700 years of English tyranny. And now, let this meeting demand the rope be on the other neck for a change.
God Almighty. For a strap of an Englishwoman, she'd talk the hind leg off a donkey.
